## NS.getFunctionRamCost() method

Get the ram cost of a netscript function.

If the given function does not exist, the function will return 0.

**Signature:**

```typescript
getFunctionRamCost(name: string): number;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  name | string | The function name. Also works with interfaces: <code>stock.getPosition</code> |

**Returns:**

number

## Remarks

RAM cost: 0 GB
